intro: Citharexylum venezuelense, commonly known as the Venezuelan honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers, which bloom in clusters, are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a pleasant scent when crushed, contributing to its ornamental value.
